doc.title: Debug
doc.desc: The Debug class provides features related to KiriKiri debugging. You cannot create objects from this class. The KiriKiri console log name is krkr.console.log. Additionally, the file created when a hardware exception occurs is hwexcept.log. These log files are located in the project directory by default. However, they will not be output if the project directory is read-only, such as when it is an archive. The log file output destination can be changed with the logLocation property (in KAG, it is set to the save data location).

member.name: message
member.shortdesc: Outputs a message to the console
member.desc: Outputs a message to the console.

member.name: notice
member.shortdesc: Outputs an important message to the console
member.desc: Outputs a message to the console. Unlike Debug.message, messages output here will always be written to the log file, even if log file writing starts later (messages output with Debug.message are only written back to a certain point). Use this to output important information that would be useful when collecting log files.

member.name: startLogToFile
member.shortdesc: Starts console log output to a file

argitem.name: clear
argitem.desc: If true is specified, the log file is cleared. If false is specified, it is appended to the existing file.

member.desc: Starts outputting the console log to a file.

member.name: logAsError
member.shortdesc: Starts log output to a file in the same way as when an error occurs
member.desc: Performs the same action as when KiriKiri encounters an error regarding the error log file. That is, if Debug.logToFileOnError is true, it starts outputting the console log to a file. At that time, if Debug.clearLogFileOnError is true, the file is cleared. In contrast, Debug.startLogToFile unconditionally starts outputting the console log to a file.

member.name: addLoggingHandler
member.desc: Registers a handler to be called every time an error log is output. The handler is called with the log message as an argument. Even if a log is output within the registered method, recursive calls are not made and are ignored.

member.name: getLastLog
member.desc: Retrieves logs that have not been output.

member.name: logLocation
member.desc: Represents the output destination directory for log files. You can also write a value to it. By default, it is set to the data storage location (command line option -datapath). Changing this value will cause subsequent logs to be output as *.console.log under that directory.

member.name: logToFileOnError
member.shortdesc: Whether to output the console log to a file when an error occurs
member.desc: If true, console log output to a file will start when an error occurs. If false, log output to a file will not start even if an error occurs.

member.name: clearLogFileOnError
member.shortdesc: Whether to clear the console log file when an error occurs
member.desc: If true, the console log will be automatically cleared when an error occurs. If false, it will not be cleared and will be appended to the existing log file.
